column4: so, i am fixing a friend's laptop. gonna use a ubuntu livecd. it just stopped working, i think it's the HDD. besides testing to see if ubuntu will load, what are some tests i can do?
to see what the actual problem is, i.e.
once booted, see if you can mount & access the (internal) disk?
how do i mount the internal disc? and if it can't, can i assume the HDD failed?
just replace it and should be good to go?
assuming first (internal) disc is /dev/sda, once booted you could try to "mount /dev/sda1 /mnt"
okay. anything else i should try?
one thing at a time :) - but yes. Running memcheck might be helpful
if it mounts, what does that mean?
Maybe better ask in ##hardware for hardware debugging support...
if it doesn't mount, does it mean the HDD needs to be replaced?
then there's no longer need to ask in #ubuntu, right? This channel is for *ubuntu* issues
well, i'm using ubuntu to dx the problem...
